info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 8:33PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Burlington, southeastern Montgomery, southeastern Bucks and northeastern Philadelphia Counties through 900 PM EDT... At 832 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rockledge, or near Philadelphia, moving northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Philadelphia, Bensalem, Ewing, Florence, Burlington, Bristol, Riverside, Palmyra, Hatboro, Jenkintown, Bordentown, Beverly, Rockledge, Yardley, Newtown, Tullytown, Abington, Langhorne, Bryn Athyn and Ivyland. This includes the following highways... Pennsylvania Turnpike between mile markers 340 and 359. Interstate 95 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 26 and 40. Interstate 295 in New Jersey near mile marker 58. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM EDT for southern and central New Jersey...and southeastern Pennsylvania.
